result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Hallio

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Hallio in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Christopher Hallio.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf of Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they are now in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher Hallio appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Christopher Hallio.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested Status hearing date to allow time to review Discovery materials with Defendant. State did not object. Defense advised the Court on possible resolution. Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Hallio appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Christopher Hallio.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requests a scheduling conference by Zoom. Case adjourned, Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.

Defendant Christopher Hallio in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Arraignment scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/22/22 @ 1p
